title: Spanakopita (Greek Spinach Pie) Recipe
description: This authentic Greek spanakopita with layers of crispy, flaky phyllo dough and a rich spinach and feta cheese filling makes an impressive main dish!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Global Cuisines European Greek Main Dishes Spanakopita (Greek Spinach Pie) 4.6 (882) 680 Reviews 121 Photos This is an authentic Greek spanakopita recipe featuring layers of crispy, flaky phyllo dough and a rich spinach and feta cheese filling. Serve this delicious savory pie warm for an impressive but easy to make vegetarian main dish. Submitted by SILVERWOLF Updated on April 14, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 121 121 121 121 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 1 (9-inch) pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe If you've never tried rich, cheesy, and utterly decadent spanakopita, you need to remedy that ASAP — and we've got just the recipe for you! With this top-rated Greek spanakopita recipe, you'll have the most delicious savory pie of your life on the table in just over an hour. What Is Spanakopita? Spanakopita is a savory Greek pie that consists of a spinach-ricotta filling baked in a buttery phyllo crust. Spanakopita Pronunciation "Spanakopita" is pronounced "spah-nah-KO-pee-tuh." How to Make Spanakopita You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this top-rated spanakopita: Make the Filling Saute onion, green onions, and garlic in olive oil until they're soft and lightly browned. Add spinach and parsley, then continue to saute until spinach is limp. Remove from heat and let cool. In a medium bowl, mix together eggs, ricotta, and feta. Stir into spinach mixture. Assemble the Spanakopita Lay one sheet of phyllo dough in a lightly oiled 9x9 inch baking pan. Brush lightly with olive oil. Lay another sheet of phyllo dough on top, brush with olive oil, and repeat this process with two more sheets of phyllo. The sheets will overlap the pan. Spread the spinach and cheese mixture into the pan and fold overhanging dough over filling. Brush with oil, then layer with the remaining sheets of phyllo dough, brushing each with oil. Seal the filling with the overhanging dough. Bake the Spanakopita Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, until golden brown. Cut into squares and serve while it's still hot. How to Store Spanakopita Store leftover spanakopita in an airtight container in the fridge for up to three days. Reheat in the oven until heated through. How to Freeze Spanakopita The best way to freeze spanakopita? Freeze it before baking. It won't lose nearly as much flavor or texture this way, as the dish won't be cooked twice. Just assemble the spanakopita, wrap it in one layer or storage wrap and one layer of aluminum foil, then freeze for up to two months. Thaw in the fridge and cook according to the recipe. You can also freeze spanakopita after baking: Simply let the dish cool and transfer it to a freezer-safe container. Freeze for up to two months. Thaw in the fridge and reheat in the oven until heated through. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "My apologies to the purists out there, but I also added fresh basil, chopped asparagus, mushrooms, and artichoke hearts," says S'more. "I have made it with none of the additions, all of the additions, and a combination of the 3 depending on what I had on hand and it always turns out phenomenal!" "This is awesome," raves Sylvia C. "We ate the whole thing in 15 minutes. I will probably need to double this next time. I used a 9-oz. bag of pre-washed spinach, chopped, and it turned out great. This would be great with a Greek salad with olives." "I used frozen spinach to save time," according to JoAnne Gauthier. "This was half-thawed and, when added to the hot mixture, it was just the right consistency and temp to keep moving and finish this. Great pie." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 3 tablespoons olive oil 1 large onion, chopped 1 bunch green onions, chopped 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 pounds spinach, rinsed and chopped ½ cup chopped fresh parsley 1 cup crumbled feta cheese ½ cup ricotta cheese 2 large eggs, lightly beaten 8 sheets phyllo dough ¼ cup olive oil, or as needed Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly oil a 9-inch square baking pan. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté chopped onion, green onions, and garlic in the hot oil until soft and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Stir in spinach and parsley, adding spinach in batches if it doesn't all fit in the pan at once, and continue to saute until spinach is limp and excess liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Recipe Tip To prevent a soggy spanakopita, allow the spinach mixture to cool and then squeeze out as much liquid as possible before moving on to the next step. You can place the spinach in a fine sieve or clean cloth and press or squeeze out excess liquid, working over the sink. Mix feta cheese, ricotta cheese, and eggs in a large bowl until well combined. Stir in spinach mixture. Lay one sheet of phyllo dough in the prepared baking pan, and brush lightly with olive oil. Lay another sheet of phyllo dough on top and brush with olive oil. Repeat the process with two more sheets of phyllo dough; the sheets will overlap the pan. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Expert Tip Our Editorial Director Diana Moutsopoulos likes to sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of semolina flour over the last layer of phyllo before adding the filling. The semolina helps to absorb excess moisture, preventing sogginess and keeping the phyllo cripsy. If you don't have semolina you can use Cream of Wheat. Spread spinach and cheese mixture into the pan. Fold any overhanging dough over the filling. Brush with oil. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Layer the remaining 4 sheets of phyllo dough, brushing each with oil. Tuck overhanging dough into the pan to seal the filling. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 30 to 40 minutes. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Cut into squares and serve while hot. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Enjoy! Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans I Made It Print 1,185 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 494 Calories 35g Fat 32g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 494 % Daily Value * Total Fat 35g 44% Saturated Fat 12g 58% Cholesterol 100mg 33% Sodium 894mg 39% Total Carbohydrate 32g 11% Dietary Fiber 7g 26% Total Sugars 5g Protein 18g 36% Vitamin C 62mg 69% Calcium 495mg 38% Iron 8mg 43% Potassium 1304mg 28% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Spanakopita (Greek Spinach Pie) 01 of 121 Photo by  Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans 02 of 121 Photo by  Andrea Blain 06/21/2023 Made this several times now - sooo good! We serve with Beetroot relish 💖 03 of 121 Photo by  TrustyEgg9835 04/03/2023 It was delicious. I strained and pat dry the spinach/parsley/etc before putting it in the egg and cheese mixture so it wouldn't be too wet to crisp up.Next time I'll add several more layers of phyllo on the top and bottom and bake it for at least an hour. 04 of 121 Photo by  HiddenCoveCreations 12/14/2022 This is fantastic! I love it. I followed the recipe exactly, except I used a 9x13 pan. It was so easy to make and it tastes so good! 05 of 121 Photo by  DizzyGrill3705 09/24/2022 First time baking with phyllo pastry , had a big bag of spinach and I did t want to waste it so I searched up Spanokopita.It’s in the oven now so gotta wait. Got some tzatziki dressing to accompany the spanakopita 🇬🇷 06 of 121 Photo by  Tlpgoody 09/06/2022 Followed the recipe with the exception of adding a bit of salt, cooked the onions, garlic and green onions separately from the spinach. I did this so I wouldn’t lose any of their flavors when I use my hands to squeeze out the excess liquid from the spinach. It worked perfectly.Truly delicious, I felt very successful using phyllo dough for the first time!🤗😋 07 of 121 Photo by  Eat 05/01/2022 08 of 121 Photo by  Miss Angel 03/29/2022 I didn't like it😟 I was like looking forward to it to. It has no flavor. I'm so sad. 09 of 121 Photo by  Lisa 09/18/2021 10 of 121 Photo by  Bridgett Daves 06/13/2021 Made ahead of time and set in the fridge to let out more moisture. I also used puff pastry and had to cook it a little longer in my oven. It was fabulous! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Loaded Greek Burgers 28 Ratings Spinach Cheese Pie 87 Ratings New Year Spinach Fettuccine with Scallops 65 Ratings Chicken Saag 86 Ratings Raghavan's Palak Masoor Dal (Red Lentils with Spinach) 4 Ratings Roasted Asparagus with Parmesan 519 Ratings Artichoke Spinach Lasagna 1,819 Ratings Instant Pot Breakfast Casserole Make-Ahead Spinach and Mozzarella Breakfast Strata Sally's Spinach Mashed Potatoes 552 Ratings Holiday Hot Spinach Dip 90 Ratings Spinach Lasagna I 30 Ratings Spinach and Cheese Stuffed Pasta Shells 210 Ratings Spinach-Mushroom Brunch Casserole 13 Ratings Breaklava 1 Rating Greek Spanakopita 345 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: SILVERWOLF
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly oil a 9-inch square baking pan. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans;Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté chopped onion, green onions, and garlic in the hot oil until soft and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans;Stir in spinach and parsley, adding spinach in batches if it doesn't all fit in the pan at once, and continue to saute until spinach is limp and excess liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Recipe Tip To prevent a soggy spanakopita, allow the spinach mixture to cool and then squeeze out as much liquid as possible before moving on to the next step. You can place the spinach in a fine sieve or clean cloth and press or squeeze out excess liquid, working over the sink.;Mix feta cheese, ricotta cheese, and eggs in a large bowl until well combined. Stir in spinach mixture. Lay one sheet of phyllo dough in the prepared baking pan, and brush lightly with olive oil. Lay another sheet of phyllo dough on top and brush with olive oil. Repeat the process with two more sheets of phyllo dough; the sheets will overlap the pan. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans Expert Tip Our Editorial Director Diana Moutsopoulos likes to sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of semolina flour over the last layer of phyllo before adding the filling. The semolina helps to absorb excess moisture, preventing sogginess and keeping the phyllo cripsy. If you don't have semolina you can use Cream of Wheat.;Spread spinach and cheese mixture into the pan. Fold any overhanging dough over the filling. Brush with oil. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans;Layer the remaining 4 sheets of phyllo dough, brushing each with oil. Tuck overhanging dough into the pan to seal the filling. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans;Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 30 to 40 minutes. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans;Cut into squares and serve while hot. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Annie Probst / Prop Stylist: Addelyn Evans;Enjoy!
